title: `rustdoc::missing_doc_code_examples` inconsistent with Rust API Guidelines

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: C-discussion
labels.description: Category: Discussion or questions that doesn't represent real issues.

body:
When the `rustdoc::missing_doc_code_examples` lint is enabled, `rustdoc` reports that doc comments which reference another example is missing an example. This is inconsistent with the [Rust API Guidelines](https://rust-lang.github.io/api-guidelines/documentation.html#all-items-have-a-rustdoc-example-c-example).

> A link to an applicable example on another item may be sufficient. For example if exactly one function uses a particular type, it may be appropriate to write a single example on either the function or the type and link to it from the other.

Given the following:

```rust
/// Does the thing.
///
/// # Example
///
/// See [`crate::bar`].
pub fn foo() {}
```

I expected to see no warnings.

Instead, this happened:

```
warning: missing code example in this documentation
45 | / /// Does the thing.
46 | | ///
47 | | /// # Example
48 | | ///
...  |
54 | | ///
   | |__________________________^
```

### Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.56.0-nightly (a6ece5615 2021-08-03)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: a6ece56152d8eb11e049e9fcce147b2859e12c92
commit-date: 2021-08-03
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.56.0-nightly
LLVM version: 12.0.1
```
